term.label: Attribute set
term.definition: A named collection of attribute definitions that can be reused, defined by an xsl:attribute-set element.

term.label: Attribute value template
term.definition: A type of attribute value that may contain an expression surrounded with curly brackets {}, usually used to set a value with information that is only available at runtime.

term.label: Character map
term.definition: A character map allows a given character in the final result tree to be substituted by a string of characters during serialization.

term.label: Collation
term.definition: A set of rules, for determining if two string values are equivalent, and how they should be ordered. Collations, which are language or application specific, are specified by a URI.

term.label: Context item
term.definition: The item currently being processed, which can be an atomic value or a node.

term.label: Current group
term.definition: The collection of related items that are processed by an xsl:for-each-group instruction.

term.label: Current grouping key
term.definition: The grouping key shared in common by all the items within the current group.

term.label: Declaration
term.definition: Top-level elements in the XSLT namespace, and defined in the XSLT specification are known as declarations. Any top level elements specified by implementers or users are called user-defined data elements.

term.label: Extension function
term.definition: A function defined by a user, a vendor, or a third party, distinct from built in functions specified in XSLT or XPath.

term.label: Function parameter
term.definition: A parameter defined in an xsl:function element. Its value can be set when the function is called in an XPath expression.

term.label: Global variable
term.definition: A top-level xsl:variable declares a global variable that is visible everywhere in a stylesheet.

term.label: Grouping keys
term.definition: When the group-by attribute or group-adjacent attributes are set on the xsl:for-each-group element, key values are calculated for each item in the population. Those with common values are then grouped together.

term.label: Import precedence
term.definition: A stylesheet module loaded using xsl:import has a lower import precedence than a module containing the import declaration. Any matching template rules in the importing module override those in the imported stylesheet.

term.label: Instruction
term.definition: An XSLT element, allowed inside a sequence constructor, that causes the processor to create a result tree fragment.

term.label: Lexical QName
term.definition: A qualified name with two parts; an optional namespace prefix and a colon, followed by the so called local part of the name. For example in xsl:param, xsl: is the prefix and param is the local name.

term.label: Literal result element
term.definition: An element name that is not in the XSLT namespace, written directly in a stylesheet; for example one of the XHTML element names.

term.label: Local variable
term.definition: An variable defined with the xsl:variable element in a sequence constructor.

term.label: Mode
term.definition: Modes allow a node in a source tree to be processed multiple ways by the same stylesheet. They also allow different sets of template rules to be active when processing different trees.

term.label: Named template
term.definition: An xsl:template element identified with a name attribute.

term.label: Output states
term.definition: Each instruction in the stylesheet is evaluated in one of two possible output states: final output state or temporary output state

term.label: Parameter
term.definition: The xsl:param element declares a parameter, the value of which value can be set by the caller.

term.label: Pattern
term.definition: A pattern specifies a set of matching conditions on a node.

term.label: Picture string
term.definition: A sequence of characters used to specify digit, grouping, and separator signs when formatting mumbers.

term.label: Population
term.definition: A sequence of items to be grouped defined in the select attribute on an xsl:for-each-group instruction.

term.label: Priority
term.definition: Each template rule is allocated a numeric priority value by the processor, based on the match pattern. This value is used to select which rule to evaluate when several rules match the same source node. The default priority may be overridden by explicitly setting the priority attribute value on the xsl:template element.

term.label: QName
term.definition: A name written as a local name optionally preceded by a namespace prefix.

term.label: Result tree
term.definition: Any temporary or final result tree constructed as the result of transforming a source tree. The result tree can be either used as a source for another transformation or serialized.

term.label: Sequence constructor
term.definition: A sequence of zero or more nodes in a stylesheet that can be evaluated to return another sequence.

term.label: Serialization
term.definition: The process of outputting a final result tree in XML or other document formats.

term.label: Sort key component
term.definition: An xsl:sort element in a sort key specification.

term.label: Sort key specification
term.definition: A sequence of one or more xsl:sort elements which define the rules for sorting the items.

term.label: Source tree
term.definition: Any node tree provided as input to the transformation, including the document containing the initial context node, documents containing nodes supplied as parameter values, or documents returned from the results of functions.

term.label: Stylesheet
term.definition: A transformation in the XSLT language containing one or more modules.

term.label: Stylesheet function
term.definition: A function that can be called from an XPath expression within the stylesheet, defined in an xsl:function declaration.

term.label: Stylesheet module
term.definition: A stylesheet may consist of one or more modules, each contained by an xsl:stylsheet or xsl:transform element.

term.label: Stylesheet parameter
term.definition: A global xsl:param element, the value of which can be set when a transformation is invoked.

term.label: Target namespace URI
term.definition: The namespace URI that is to be used in the result tree as a substitute for a literal namespace URI is called the target namespace URI.

term.label: Template
term.definition: An xsl:template declaration defines a template, containing a sequence constructor for creating nodes or atomic values in a result document. It can be either a template rule containing a pattern to match, or a named template, invoked by name.

term.label: Template parameter
term.definition: A local variable defined by an xsl:param element which can be set when the template is called.

term.label: Template rule
term.definition: A stylesheet contains a set of template rules. Each rule has a pattern that is matched against nodes, an optional set of template parameters, and a sequence constructor.

term.label: Temporary tree
term.definition: Any node tree, usually constructed inside a variable, other than source tree or a final result tree.

term.label: Tunnel parameter
term.definition: A parameter that is recursively passed on by a called template to any further called templates.

term.label: Variable
term.definition: The xsl:variable element declares a variable, which may be a global variable or a local variable.

term.label: Whitespace text node
term.definition: A text node consisting entirely the whitespace characters #x09, #x0A, #x0D, or #x20.
